content: The organization IG only allows for organizations to return 1 and only 1 NPI, but we have found organizations that can have 1 to n NPIs. Has the IG considered modifying the resource to allow for more than one NPI?
how common are multiple NPIs for a single organization needed in interchange? (first time that this issue has been brought up, that I am aware of)
We've seen it come up about 5% of the time
Is that the result of there being multiple underlying organizations? Or why does it occur?
Pretty much. there are multiple underlying organizations, each with its own NPI. If there are 3 underlying organizations, the parent represents itself with all 3 NPIs
Doesn't the context determine which one of the underlying organizations is the relevant one?
So i feel like the underlying ones have an NPI each and the parent does not
We find it at the medical group level. The medical groups can have 1-n NPIs based on how they are constructed, with underlying groups - departments having their own NPI.
